content.title: YSR Nethanna Nestham
content.details: Being implemented since December 2019, the scheme 'YSR Nethanna Nestham' is a Financial Assistance Scheme by the Department of Handlooms & Textiles, Government of Andhra Pradesh. The objective of the scheme is to help the Weavers to modernize their equipment and compete with the products from the powerloom sector, ₹ 24,000/- will be provided to every Weaver family who owns a Handloom. The scheme is applicable to all Handloom Weavers who are actually engaged in Handloom Weaving and eking their livelihood from Weaving, and who are present in the Departmental Data Base.
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹ 24,000/- will be provided to every Weaver family who owns a Handloom in order to help the Weavers modernize their equipment and compete with the products from the powerloom sector.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Andhra Pradesh.
The applicant should be a Handloom Weaver engaged in Handloom Weaving and eking their livelihood from Weaving, and who are present in the Departmental Database.
The applicant is required to be affiliated and registered with the Handloom Association.
The family of the applicant should own a handloom.
One weaver family shall be eligible for only one benefit, irrespective of the number of looms owned by them.
The weaver family shall belong to the Below the Poverty Line category.
content.application_process: Online. The eligible weavers need not apply to the scheme as their details are already in the department's database. The prepared Nethana Nestham beneficiary lists are available online as well as offline. The lists are being displayed in the panchayat offices as well as on the official website.
documents_required: Proof of Age / Date of Birth
Registration Certificate issued by State Handloom Association.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to help the Weavers to modernize their equipment and compete with the products from the powerloom sector.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance That A Weaver Family Can Receive Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹ 24,000/- will be provided to every Weaver family who owns a Handloom.

faqs.question: Which Department Manages This Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by the Department of Handlooms & Textiles, Government of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: Who Can Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is applicable to all Handloom Weavers who are actually engaged in Handloom Weaving and eking their livelihood from Weaving, and who are present in the departmental database.

faqs.question: For What Purposes Can The Amount Of Financial Assistance Be Utilized?
faqs.answer: The amount of financial assistance can be utilized to modernize their equipment and compete with the products from the powerloom sector.

faqs.question: Can Weaver Families From Telangana Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, in order to be eligible to apply, the applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: Will The Amount Of Financial Assistance Also Depend On The Number Of Looms Owned By The Family?
faqs.answer: No, one weaver family shall be eligible for only one benefit, irrespective of the number of looms owned by them.

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory For The Applicant To Be Affiliated And Registered With The Handloom Association?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant is required to be affiliated and registered with the Handloom Association.

faqs.question: What Is The Purpose Of The Social Audit?
faqs.answer: Through the social audit, the re-verification of the existing Weaver database with the department by village and ward volunteers will be done to cover leftover beneficiaries, if any, deletions and updation of details.

faqs.question: Can I Get The List Of Eligible Beneficiaries From The Panchayat Office?
faqs.answer: Yes, the lists are being displayed in the panchayat offices as well as on the official website.

faqs.question: How Will The Amount Of Financial Assistance Be Disbursed To The Eligible Beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The amount of financial assistance will be disbursed to the eligible beneficiaries through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: Can The Weaver Families Who Are Above Poverty Line Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only open to the weaver families from the Below the Poverty Line (BPL) category.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme State Sponsored Or Centrally Sponsored?
faqs.answer: This scheme is a 100% State Sponsored Scheme.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The Scheme Guidelines?
faqs.answer: The Scheme Guidelines can be found at this link - https://www.aphandtex.gov.in/open_record.php?ID=178

faqs.question: Does This Scheme Accept Online Applications?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme only accepts offline applications.

faqs.question: What Is The URL Of The Website Of The Department Of Handlooms & Textiles, Government Of Andhra Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The URL of the website of the Department of Handlooms & Textiles is https://www.aphandtex.gov.in/home.php.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: Is There A Percentage Of Slots Reserved For Female Applicants?
faqs.answer: No, there is no reservation of slots based on the gender of the applicant.

faqs.question: Since When Is This Scheme Under Implementation?
faqs.answer: This scheme under implementation since December 2019.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Statement Showing The District-Wise Allocation Of Weaver Households And Funds?
faqs.answer: The statement showing the district-wise allocation of Weaver households and funds can be found in the scheme guidelines - https://www.aphandtex.gov.in/open_record.php?ID=178
